intro: Heliophila collina, commonly known as the mountain heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Heliophila collina is often found in meadows and mountainous habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
